pullrequest.title: Add fix_shortcuts() function and catch DLL load error

content.raw:
Hey,

I hoped that this would remove an error we faced recently when updating labscript: Python crashes when starting blacs. The crash occurs after blacs the info message “BLACS instantiated”. It says the module causing the error is Qt5Widgets.dll. I will add some pics from the windows error message.

Before it was that the error occurred first when clicking on the tab of a specific NI\_card. Python crashed only for one DO-card out \(not for the other DO-card and not for any other NI-card\). But after a restart the error changed to what I wrote above.

Actually, we had this error on a second experiment computer as well but on this one I somehow managed to get around it \(probably by restarting the computer\)

So one the second computer the problem stays and blacs does not launch anymore.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/xg9BdE/images/2822184549-DSC_2312.JPG)
![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/xg9BdE/images/1331840835-DSC_2311.JPG)
![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/xg9BdE/images/3033597980-DSC_2313.JPG)
content.html:
Hey,

I hoped that this would remove an error we faced recently when updating labscript: Python crashes when starting blacs. The crash occurs after blacs the info message “BLACS instantiated”. It says the module causing the error is Qt5Widgets.dll. I will add some pics from the windows error message.

Before it was that the error occurred first when clicking on the tab of a specific NI_card. Python crashed only for one DO-card out (not for the other DO-card and not for any other NI-card). But after a restart the error changed to what I wrote above.

Actually, we had this error on a second experiment computer as well but on this one I somehow managed to get around it (probably by restarting the computer)

So one the second computer the problem stays and blacs does not launch anymore.
